disobedience.question:
Was I disobedient to my parents? 

(Considering the traits shared, it's likely that this demographic has children under 18 and therefore would be inclined to reflect on their behavior as a parent.)
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: through frustrated reactions to others in my community
disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Catholic Church through frustrated reactions to others in my community?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you deliberately skip days of fasting during Lent, treating them lightly and failing to make amends for this disobedience?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you disrespect the Church through your words?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

resent.question: Am I sluggish in my duties?
resent.description: Laziness represents is a failure to fulfill oneâ€™s basic duties.

resent.question: Have I become sterilized?
resent.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately altering one's fertility represents an act of defiance against God and implies we know better than divine wisdom, placing our desires for control above trust in God's plan for our lives.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not given proper burial?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, particularly after engaging in actions that involved a substantial amount of time and resources on activities other than those related to my faith or spiritual growth?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

over serving their needs and well - being
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence my decisions and treatment of others in ways that prioritize personal gain over serving their needs and well-being?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: such as my children and friends
ambition.question: Did my desire for power and dominance influence how I interacted with others, particularly those closest to me, such as my children and friends?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make the pursuit of wealth and material possessions a driving force in my life, leading me to idolize money and trust it over God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that were unjust , cruel , or oppressive
oppression.question: Did I use my authority or power over others in ways that were unjust, cruel, or oppressive?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the fruits of my own hard work, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding me towards success?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I been resentful of others' accomplishments, inwardly wishing they would lose their success?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did you choose to work on Sunday, a day reserved for rest and worship?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impurity.question: Did you intentionally use certain practices or substances to prevent pregnancy within marriage?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.
